# UD Georgian GNC

Language: [Georgian](/ka/index.html) (code: `ka`)<br/>
Family: Kartvelian

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.16 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Paul Meurer.

Repository: [UD_Georgian-GNC](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Georgian-GNC)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udka_gnc216)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.16](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: fiction, news

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Georgian-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Georgian-GNC/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [paul&nbsp;•&nbsp;meurer&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;uib&nbsp;•&nbsp;no].
Development of the treebank happens outside the UD repository.
If there are bugs, either the original data source or the conversion procedure must be fixed.
Do not submit pull requests against the UD repository.

| Annotation | Source |
|------------|--------|
| Lemmas | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |
| UPOS | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |
| XPOS | annotated manually |
| Features | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |
| Relations | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

## Description

UD_Georgian-GNC is a treebank based on texts from the Georgian National Corpus, [GNC](https://clarino.uib.no/gnc).



UD_Georgian-GNC is a treebank based on texts from the Georgian National Corpus, [GNC](https://clarino.uib.no/gnc), which is a corpus of written texts from a variety of genres. The sentences are taken from original and translated novels and from news websites.

The sentences are analysed using a finite state morphological analyser, and Constraint Grammar rules for disambiguation and dependency parsing. Both disambiguation and dependency analyses are corrected manually in a tool specifically developed for that purpose.

## Acknowledgments

The Georgian treebank and the tools used to create it have been developed by Paul Meurer.

<li>This corpus contains 1531 sentences and 18747 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 4449 tokens (24%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 49 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: -მეთქი, კ-მ, კ-ს, ბ-ნ, დ., თვალ-ყური, კ., მე-15, ნელ-ნელა, პატარ-პატარა, 77-მა, ამხანაგ-მეგობრობას, არსებობა-არარსებობისა, აქეთ-იქით, გადასერ-გადმოსერეს, გაიარ-გამოიარა, გოგო-ბიჭები, და-ძმა, დილ-დილაობით, ერთ-ერთ, ერთ-ერთი, ერთი-ორი, ექვსი-შვიდი, თითო-თითოდ, კუთხე-კუნჭულს, მეტ-ნაკლებად, მეტ-ნაკლები, მიიხედ-მოიხედა, მხატვარ-პეიზაჟისტის, ნაზირ-ვეზირები, ნაირ-ნაირი, ოდა-სახლს, ორი-სამი, ორმოცი-ორმოცდაათი, რ., ს., სადილ-ვახშამს, სალამ-ქალამის, სასმელ-საჭმელით, სახნავ-სათესიც, სსრკ-, უნარ-შესაძლებლობებით, შაბათ-კვირის, შეხლა-შემოხლის, ციხე-ქალაქებს, ცოლ-შვილი, ჭამა-სმა, ხვევნა-კოცნასა, ჯორ-აქლემი</li>

      <li>NOUN-Vnoun: განგებამ, თვალთვალმა, მოგონებამ, ძიებამ</li>
      <li>NUM: ათმა, მეორე</li>
      <li>PRON: მან, ამ, ვინ, მე, ჩვენ, თქვენ, რამ, არავინ, მისმა, ჩვენმა</li>
      <li>PROPN: სოფიმ, თუთაშხიამ, დათა, ვარდენ, ზარანდიამ, კ-მ, მექვაბიშვილმა, ერიკამ, ვარდენმა, თემუროვიჩმა</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

    <ul>

      <li>NUM: მეორე, პირველი, მე-15, მეორეს, მეოთხი, მეორეც, მეოცე, მერვე, მესამე, მესამეს</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

  <li><a>Poss</a></li>
</ul>

  <li>Yes
    <ul>
      <li>PRON: მისი, თავის, თავისი, მის, ჩემი, ჩემს, მათი, ჩვენი, თქვენი, შენი</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: არის, ყოფნა.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 6 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: არის, უნდა, ქონა, შეიძლება, შეძლება, ქმნა.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Dat (49)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Erg (115)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Nom (501)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Dat (53)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Erg (43)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Nom (238)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (32)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Nom (9)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Dat (233)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Ess (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Gen (2)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Nom (468)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Dat (80)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Nom (84)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (10)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Nom (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Dat (240)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Dat-ADP(შორის) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Gen (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON-Dat (71)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Dat (3)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 12 relation subtypes: <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>advcl:relcl</a>, <a>advmod:neg</a>, <a>ccomp:speech</a>, <a>csubj:outer</a>, <a>det:poss</a>, <a>nmod:iobj</a>, <a>nmod:name</a>, <a>nmod:pred</a>, <a>obl:agent</a>, <a>obl:final</a>, <a>obl:iobj</a></li>
<li>The following 9 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>expl</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>flat</a>, <a>compound</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
</ul>
